claim: Global live television viewership for the Austrian Grand Prix that recorded the fastest lap speed exceeded 20 million.
extra_info: Fastest lap speed refers to MIN(fastestLapTime)
reasoning: The claim references 'Global live television viewership,' but the database contains no columns or tables related to television viewership, audience figures, or any broadcasting metrics. This is an out-of-schema concept that cannot be verified from the available Formula 1 data.

content.text:
I'll analyze this claim step by step. First, let me understand the claim: it's about "Global live television viewership" for a specific Austrian Grand Prix race.

Let me explore the database schema to see what data is available.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
circuits              drivers               results             
constructorResults    lapTimes              seasons             
constructorStandings  pitStops              status              
constructors          qualifying          
driverStandings       races

tool_use_result.stdout:
circuits              drivers               results             
constructorResults    lapTimes              seasons             
constructorStandings  pitStops              status              
constructors          qualifying          
driverStandings       races

content.content:
CREATE TABLE races
(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE races
(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE results
(
    resultId        INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    raceId          INTEGER default 0  not null,
    driverId        INTEGER default 0  not null,
    constructorId   INTEGER default 0  not null,
    number          INTEGER,
    grid            INTEGER default 0  not null,
    position        INTEGER,
    positionText    TEXT    default '' not null,
    positionOrder   INTEGER default 0  not null,
    points          REAL   default 0  not null,
    laps            INTEGER default 0  not null,
    time            TEXT,
    milliseconds    INTEGER,
    fastestLap      INTEGER,
    rank            INTEGER default 0,
    fastestLapTime  TEXT,
    fastestLapSpeed TEXT,
    statusId        INTEGER default 0  not null,
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (driverId) references drivers(driverId),
    foreign key (constructorId) references constructors(constructorId),
    foreign key (statusId) references status(statusId)
);

content.text: The claim references "Global live television viewership" — let me check if any table in the database contains viewership data.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE circuits
(
    circuitId  INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    circuitRef TEXT default '' not null,
    name       TEXT default '' not null,
    location   TEXT,
    country    TEXT,
    lat        REAL,
    lng        REAL,
    alt        INTEGER,
    url        TEXT default '' not null
        unique
);

tool_use_result.stdout:

    lng        REAL,
    alt        INTEGER,
    url        TEXT default '' not null
        unique

content.text:
The database schema contains tables for races, results, drivers, constructors, circuits, lap times, pit stops, qualifying, standings, seasons, and status. **None of these tables contain any column related to "television viewership"** or any audience/viewer metrics.

The claim asks about "Global live television viewership" which is an OUT-OF-SCHEMA concept — the database simply does not track viewership data for any race.
